alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Cobb (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 05 at 6:26PM EDT until August 06 at 12:30AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: The National Weather Service in Peachtree City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Cherokee County in north central Georgia... Northeastern Cobb County in north central Georgia... * Until 1230 AM EDT Saturday. * At 626 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Marietta, Sandy Springs, Roswell, Kennesaw, Woodstock, Sandy Plains, White Water Park, Sweat Mountain, Kennesaw State University and Mount Bethel. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
